questions.text: Does the company produce an approved annual budget before the fiscal year begins?
questions.help: Baseline — Without a budget, 'performance' is just an opinion.

expert_action.title: Implement Annual Budget Cycle
expert_action.recommendation: Establish a formal budget calendar working backwards 3-4 months. Crucially, secure explicit leadership sponsorship to enforce deadlines. Assign clear ownership for timeline management.

questions.text: Does the budget include a full P&L down to Net Income (not just Revenue/Opex)?
questions.help: Completeness — Revenue-only budgets hide profitability issues.

expert_action.title: Extend Budget to Full P&L
expert_action.recommendation: Add interest expense, tax provision, and below-the-line items to your budget template. Even rough estimates are better than ignoring these lines.

questions.text: Can every line of budgeted OpEx be mapped to a specific human owner (e.g., department head)?
questions.help: Ownership Mapping — General ledgers hide waste; specific owners reveal it.

expert_action.title: Assign Budget Ownership
expert_action.recommendation: Create a simple RACI matrix mapping every cost center to a named owner. Publish it. Make budget reviews part of their job description.

questions.text: Do department heads formally sign off on their budget numbers before the year starts?
questions.help: Commitment — Communication ≠ Agreement.

expert_action.title: Implement Budget Sign-Off
expert_action.recommendation: Add a formal sign-off step before budget consolidation. Can be as simple as email confirmation, but documented.

questions.text: Is there a single, documented chart of accounts used by all business units?
questions.help: Data Standard — Inconsistent data makes analysis impossible.

expert_action.title: Standardize Chart of Accounts
expert_action.recommendation: Document your canonical CoA. Identify and map local variations. Create governance for new account requests.

questions.text: Are spending approvals systematically rejected by Finance when they exceed delegated authority, without escalation to override the controls?
questions.help: Cash Control — Controls only matter if Finance enforces them.

expert_action.title: Implement Reconciliation Process
expert_action.recommendation: Create a monthly reconciliation checklist covering all sub-ledgers. Document variances and resolution.

questions.text: Are cash reconciliations completed monthly to ensure the reported cash position is real?
questions.help: Cash Reality — Ensuring the P&L matches the bank reality.

expert_action.title: Create Close Checklist
expert_action.recommendation: Document every step of your close process with owners and deadlines. Start with what you do today, then optimize.

questions.text: Are system access controls (SoD) enforced to prevent unauthorized changes to the source data that FP&A analyzes?
questions.help: Source Integrity — Linking IT control to FP&A data quality.

expert_action.title: Implement Journal Entry Controls
expert_action.recommendation: Require documentation and approval for all manual entries above a threshold. Segregate entry from approval.

questions.text: Is there a standard monthly management reporting package distributed to leadership?
questions.help: Reporting Baseline — No pack = flying blind.

expert_action.title: Create Standard Reporting Package
expert_action.recommendation: Design a consistent monthly pack covering P&L, key metrics, and commentary. Distribute within 3-5 business days of close.

questions.text: Is a Budget vs. Actuals (BvA) report generated every month?
questions.help: Feedback Loop — You can't manage what you don't measure.

expert_action.title: Implement Monthly BvA Reporting
expert_action.recommendation: Create a BvA report as part of your standard close. Show budget, actual, variance, and variance %. Distribute to all budget owners.

questions.text: Are variances exceeding a defined threshold (e.g., 10%) formally investigated?
questions.help: Consequence — Reports are useless without investigation.

expert_action.title: Establish Variance Investigation Protocol
expert_action.recommendation: Define materiality thresholds (e.g., >10% and >$10K). Require documented explanations for breaches. Review in monthly finance meeting.

questions.text: Do department heads actively review their BvA performance with Finance monthly?
questions.help: Active Ownership — Active ownership vs. passive reporting.

expert_action.title: Add Variance Commentary
expert_action.recommendation: Require budget owners to explain variances in writing. Template: What happened? Is it timing or permanent? What action are you taking?

questions.text: Can the consolidated financial package be generated in less than 4 hours after books close?
questions.help: Speed to Truth (System) — Manual consolidation is slow and error-prone.

expert_action.title: Define Materiality Thresholds
expert_action.recommendation: Document escalation thresholds (e.g., >$50K auto-escalates to CFO). Publish and enforce.

questions.text: Does the BvA process include a review of headcount and personnel costs?
questions.help: People Cost — People are 70% of OpEx.

expert_action.title: Distribute BvA to Budget Owners
expert_action.recommendation: Send each budget owner their specific BvA report monthly. Don't wait for them to ask.

questions.text: Is the live forecast stored in a multi-user system (not a single-user spreadsheet)?
questions.help: Collaboration (System) — Single-user spreadsheets kill collaboration.

expert_action.title: Migrate to Collaborative Planning
expert_action.recommendation: Invest in dedicated FP&A software (e.g., DataRails, Planful). If not feasible, move to cloud sheets with strict version control. Stop single-user files.

questions.text: Does the forecast project cash flow and liquidity, not just P&L?
questions.help: Liquidity — Profit ≠ Cash. Blindness here is fatal.

expert_action.title: Add Cash Flow to Forecast
expert_action.recommendation: Build a 13-week cash flow model alongside your P&L forecast. Start with direct method: receipts and payments.

questions.text: When the forecast is wrong, does Finance lead a documented post mortem to improve the process rather than focusing on blame?
questions.help: Culture of Improvement — Blame cultures breed sandbagging (lying).

expert_action.title: Implement Monthly Forecast Refresh
expert_action.recommendation: Update monthly focusing only on material changes. Perform a full 're-budget' or deep forecast quarterly.

questions.text: Does Finance have the authority to challenge and adjust operational inputs (e.g. Sales) before they become the official plan?
questions.help: Authority — Is Finance a partner or a data-entry clerk?

expert_action.title: Create R&O Register
expert_action.recommendation: Maintain a list of upside opportunities and downside risks not in the baseline forecast. Quantify probability and impact. Review monthly.

questions.text: Can Finance present a true but pessimistic forecast without being labeled 'not a team player'?
questions.help: Truth Telling — The 'Cassandra' problem.

expert_action.title: Build Scenario Capability
expert_action.recommendation: Create a base forecast model with driver assumptions that can flex. Define standard scenarios (recession, growth, base).

questions.text: Does Finance explicitly track and communicate systematic forecast bias (e.g. persistent optimism or conservatism) to management?
questions.help: Forecast Bias — Optimism and sandbagging destroy planning credibility.

expert_action.title: Track Forecast Accuracy
expert_action.recommendation: Measure forecast vs. actual each month. Track bias (consistently high or low?) and absolute error. Share with leadership.

questions.text: Is there a single person clearly accountable for the integrity and delivery of the end-to-end budget process?
questions.help: Accountability — Committees don't deliver quality; owners do.

expert_action.title: Assign Budget Process Owner
expert_action.recommendation: Name one person accountable for budget timeline, templates, and consolidation. Doesn't need to be senior—needs to be organized and empowered.

questions.text: Is there a standard, consistently applied process across all entities governing manual journal entries (e.g. documentation, review, approval)?
questions.help: Manipulation Risk — Ensuring inputs aren't cooked before FP&A sees them.

expert_action.title: Implement Journal Entry Review
expert_action.recommendation: Define threshold for mandatory review (e.g., >$10K). Implement maker-checker workflow. Document reviewer approval.

questions.text: Does the management reporting package include written narrative (what happened, why, what's next), not just data tables?
questions.help: Reporting Quality — Tables without narrative don't drive decisions.

expert_action.title: Add Forward-Looking Commentary
expert_action.recommendation: Include a 'Looking Ahead' section in your monthly pack. Cover: next month expectations, risks emerging, actions planned.

questions.text: When the financial plan shows a project (eg. a Hire) is unaffordable, does leadership accept the constraint rather than demanding the numbers be 'fixed'?
questions.help: Math Matters — Ignoring unit economics leads to ruin.

expert_action.title: Build Constraint Credibility
expert_action.recommendation: Start with clearly justified constraints. (Corporate: cash runway/covenants. BU: portfolio role/profit targets). Document agreement.

questions.text: Do business unit leaders explain how their operational decisions (pricing, headcount, etc.) impact P&L?
questions.help: Financial Literacy — Ops needs to understand their own drivers.

expert_action.title: Insert Finance into Approval Workflow
expert_action.recommendation: Implement policy: spending above threshold requires Finance review before commitment. Frame as 'helping you build the business case.'

questions.text: Has Finance ever killed or delayed a project because unit economics didn't work, and leadership accepted the decision?
questions.help: Influence — The ultimate test: stopping bad decisions.

expert_action.title: Establish Business Review Cadence
expert_action.recommendation: Create monthly 1:1s between Finance and each BU leader. Agenda: their forecast, their concerns, their needs from Finance.

questions.text: Does Finance actively produce a regular report identifying unprofitable business segments?
questions.help: Value Creation — Identifying where value is destroyed.

expert_action.title: Create Challenge Culture
expert_action.recommendation: Get CEO to explicitly endorse Finance's role in challenging assumptions. Use 'help me understand' framing vs. 'you're wrong.'

questions.text: Do executives regularly ask Finance 'what should we do?' rather than just 'make the numbers work'?
questions.help: Partnership — Advisor vs. Scorekeeper.

expert_action.title: Establish Update Protocol
expert_action.recommendation: Define expectation: material changes communicated within 48 hours. Make it easy (phone call, email)—do not rely on complex forms.

questions.text: When Finance presents a downside scenario, does leadership engage with it seriously or dismiss it as 'too negative'?
questions.help: Resilience — Engaging with the 'Bear Case'.

expert_action.title: Normalize Realistic Forecasting
expert_action.recommendation: Present ranges instead of points. Lead with 'most likely' but always show downside. Document assumptions clearly.

questions.text: Does the monthly review explicitly track and quantify a Risks and Opportunities (R&O) list distinct from the base budget?
questions.help: R&O Discipline — Forecasts are ranges, not points.

expert_action.title: Exercise the No Muscle
expert_action.recommendation: Establish a clear framework with Top Management for project viability to avoid power plays. Use this to objectively recommend killing marginal projects.

questions.text: Can executives clearly explain the 2-3 key drivers that determine financial success, without prompting from Finance?
questions.help: Driver Clarity — Focusing on causes, not just effects.

expert_action.title: Make Downside Scenarios Actionable
expert_action.recommendation: Don't just present 'what if bad.' Present 'what if bad, and here's the action plan.' Ensure action plans are owned multifunctionally, not just by Finance.

questions.text: In the last 12 months, has a budget been formally reallocated mid-year based on changing business reality?
questions.help: Agility — Moving money when reality changes.

expert_action.title: Build Driver Literacy
expert_action.recommendation: Identify the 3-5 drivers that explain 80% of financial performance. Create a simple 'driver dashboard.' Discuss in every leadership meeting.

questions.text: Does Finance stress-test models to highlight exactly what happens to cash/profit if specific variables (e.g., volume, price) drop?
questions.help: Stress Testing — Understanding breaking points.

expert_action.title: Implement Stress Testing
expert_action.recommendation: Model 2-3 stress scenarios (revenue -20%, cost spike). Show impact on key business metrics (and corporate cash/covenants where relevant). Ensure CEO/CFO awareness.

questions.text: Does Finance actively track and challenge the financial performance of the key value-creation initiatives (projects, products, or growth bets) underpinning the annual plan and strategic roadmap?
questions.help: Value Creation Focus — FP&A maturity is about steering value, not just explaining variance.

expert_action.title: Track Strategic Initiative Performance
expert_action.recommendation: Get the list of strategic initiatives and Value Creation Plans. Define financial KPIs for each. Report progress monthly.

questions.text: Has Finance deliberately stopped, simplified, or automated recurring reports to free up capacity for analysis and decision support?
questions.help: Capacity for Insight — Insight requires stopping low-value work.

expert_action.title: Insert Finance into Pricing
expert_action.recommendation: Create pricing guardrails: minimum margins, discount approval levels. Provide Sales with a simple tool showing deal profitability.

questions.text: Can Finance explain the financial outlook primarily using operational drivers (units, capacity, customers) rather than accounting terminology?
questions.help: Business Language — Finance maturity shows when numbers translate into operations.

expert_action.title: Build Rapid Response Capability
expert_action.recommendation: Create pre-built analysis templates for common questions. Maintain clean, accessible data. Protect analyst capacity from recurring work.

questions.text: Are the key KPIs and their definitions consistent across all executive reports?
questions.help: KPI Consistency — Same KPI, different number destroys trust.

expert_action.title: Connect Budget to Strategy
expert_action.recommendation: Build a 3-year model that rolls into the annual budget. Place the Value Creation Model at the center.

questions.text: Can executives answer routine performance questions from existing reports/dashboards without requesting ad-hoc analysis from FP&A?
questions.help: Self-Serve Maturity — Ad-hoc requests signal immaturity.

expert_action.title: Implement Leading Indicators
expert_action.recommendation: Identify 5-7 leading indicators for your business (pipeline, NPS, churn signals, etc.). Include in monthly pack.

questions.text: Is there a formal 'lock-in' meeting where Sales and Finance must agree on a single number before the forecast is finalized?
questions.help: Alignment — One number, one plan.

expert_action.title: Enable Self-Serve Analytics
expert_action.recommendation: Deploy BI tool (Power BI, Looker, Tableau) with curated financial datasets. Train power users in each BU.

questions.text: Do functional leaders (Sales, HR, Ops) use Finance's reports as their primary data source (rather than maintaining parallel spreadsheets)?
questions.help: Shadow IT — If Ops uses Excel, the ERP is a graveyard.

expert_action.title: Build Single Source of Truth
expert_action.recommendation: Create a canonical data layer (data warehouse) and leverage FP&A software to eliminate shadow spreadsheets.

questions.text: In executive meetings, do all leaders reference the same financial figures?
questions.help: One Truth — The CEO test.

expert_action.title: Automate Data Pipelines
expert_action.recommendation: Map your critical data flows. Prioritize by volume and error frequency. Implement automated extraction (APIs, scheduled queries).

questions.text: When the CFO presents to the board, are the numbers aligned with what other executives cite?
questions.help: Board Trust — Misalignment shows up in the boardroom.

expert_action.title: Explore Statistical Forecasting
expert_action.recommendation: Start simple: time series analysis on revenue. Use tools like Prophet if you have data science capabilities.

questions.text: Does the 3-year strategic plan actually impact annual budget decisions?
questions.help: Strategic Linkage — Strategy must constrain the budget.

expert_action.title: Build Real-Time Dashboards
expert_action.recommendation: Identify 3-5 metrics that benefit from real-time visibility (cash, bookings, pipeline). Connect directly to source systems.

questions.text: Does Finance use any automated algorithmic forecasting (e.g., machine learning) to validate human inputs?
questions.help: Algorithmic Maturity — Beyond simple arithmetic.

expert_action.title: Create Strategic Capacity
expert_action.recommendation: Audit time spent on BAU (Business As Usual) vs. strategic. Target: 70/30 split. Automate or eliminate low-value BAU work.

questions.text: Can Finance instantly drill down from the P&L to transaction-level detail (customer/SKU) without running a new offline manual report?
questions.help: Dimensionality (System) — Speed to insight requires drill-down, not new extracts.

expert_action.title: Implement Finance Retrospectives
expert_action.recommendation: Run a retrospective after each close and budget cycle (Kaizen). What worked? What didn't? Pick one improvement per cycle.

questions.text: Does Finance communicate a profitability ranking of business streams/customers to make it clear where money is actually made?
questions.help: Strategic Courage — Ranking value creators vs. destroyers.

expert_action.title: Join Cross-Functional Planning
expert_action.recommendation: Ensure planning is a cross-functional activity (e.g., S&OP or similar)—not an isolated finance exercise. Bring financial lens to operational decisions.

questions.text: Does Finance proactively monitor and communicate external signals (market trends, competitor moves) that impact the forecast?
questions.help: External Awareness — Looking outside the building.

expert_action.title: Integrate External Data
expert_action.recommendation: Identify 3-5 external indicators relevant to your business. Subscribe to data feeds or track manually. Include in planning assumptions.

questions.text: Is the 'Financial Truth' stored in a robust system with version control, audit trails, and backup (vs. offline spreadsheets that are prone to breaking)?
questions.help: Data Stability (System) — Excel is fragile; Systems are robust.

expert_action.title: Explore Predictive Analytics
expert_action.recommendation: Start with one use case: churn prediction, deal probability. Partner with data science team or use simple tools.
